rComments: Definitely cared about everyone learning what he was teaching, and the material was always interesting.

Josh's God's economy class was a really interesting look at Capitalism and Christianity in American Society. Having never taken any classes in American Studies or the History of Consciousness I felt this class was very informative and revealing of structures in American Society. Josh is a great teacher and very good at facilitating discussion!

I took Josh's class, God's Economy, my first quarter at UCSC. Josh is still (I'm a third-year now) the most engaging, passionate, and down-to-earth professor I've ever had. His lectures are fleshed-out with powerpoints/visuals and interesting readings (sometimes a lot) to back them up. If you can take a class from him, DO IT, he'll make you think.
Great lecturer! He made the material lively and interesting through his own enthusiasm and creative way of teaching history, loved the class!
A very lively and interesting professor. Josh delivered the material in a way where one could both laugh and retain the information. Thorough and thoughtful, this guy is great!

Josh was really one of the best teachers I've ever had. He was helpful with anything you needed, he was friendly, the course was incredibly interesting and he found really diverse ways to teach it. I would recommend it to absolutely anybody.

Josh was an excellent teacher. I took his class the first quarter he taught it & some of the reading was extensive, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. He brought in YouTube clips that seemed not only relevant to the course, but deeply profound in the context of our own lives. If you are looking to pick up an interesting & thought provoking GE, this is it
